page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: Belsay sits astride the busy A696 road from{Newcastle to Otterburn.}This road joins the A68 north of Otterburn and travels over{Carter Bar into {Scotland. In recent years there have been plans to by-pass the village because of the fast trunk road causing danger to inhabitants and school-children. The Police hold regular speed checks, standing within the school gates. There are 4 daily National Express buses through Belsay to{Edinburgh}and 4 to{Newcastle.}A private company runs 4 buses to Newcastle - 2 on school holidays, and 4 to{Otterburn}- 2 on school holidays. Also there is a bus every Friday to the local market town of{Morpeth.
